publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-250# Ms Irene Oldfather: Tobacco Sales to Under-Aged Children-That the Parliament notes that surveys by trading standards officers in North Ayrshire and the Borders indicate that tobacco continues to be sold to under-aged children; notes that those retailers who are successfully prosecuted are treated leniently; and calls upon the Scottish Executive to establish a system of negative licensing under the jurisdiction of local licensing boards, whereby retailers who repeatedly sell tobacco to young people will lose their right to sell age restricted products altogether.
S1M-250# Tobacco Sales to Under-Aged Children (lodged on 3 November 1999) Kay Ullrich*
